GeneralInformation.School Vision: A Vibrant and Connected Community that Aspires, Learns and Leads
GeneralInformation.School Mission: Together, we build an inviting and enriched environment to nurture passionate learners, creative thinkers and caring leaders.
School Philosophy, Culture and Ethos: "Yeu Nerng School' was founded by the late Mr Huang Hua Long and four villagers as a humble Chinese School in 1935. 82 years on, the school has become a government school, and continues to grow together with the Bedok community. Since Yu Neng Primary School has established itself as a school of choice, recognised for its excellence in both the academic and non-academic domains, with outstanding achievement particularly in Sports and ICT.

In tandem with Singapore's rapid development over the decades, Yu Neng too, has evolved over time. Guided by the school values GR3IT - Graciousness, Respect, Responsibility, Resilience, Integrity, and Teamwork, we are committed to prepare our students to be future-ready and ready to handle the challenges of the volatile and complex world.

The 6-year Yu Neng Experience aims to nurture passionate learners, creative thinkers and caring leaders where learning opportunities are accessible to all, regardless of backgrounds. By providing a student-centric values driven education, we want to inspire every student to 'think big and dream big' and to provide them with the necessary support, platforms and opportunities to excel and thrive in the 21st century.
GeneralInformation.Type of School: Government School / Co-ed School / Single Session

SpecialProgrammes.Special Student Development Programmes O: The well-rounded 6-year curriculum is designed to provide every student the opportunity to grow the joy of learning, demonstrate thinking and creativity, and nurture leadership skills. A variety of pedagogical approaches are adopted to engage the mind, heart and hands of the students. The school's vibrant learning environment, supported by ICT, extends learning beyond the classrooms and lends a leading edge for our students in the knowledge-driven society.
